verses.roman:
nikaṭe hari-dhvani śuni' parakāśānanda
dekhite kautuke āilā lañā śiṣya-vṛnda

synonyms: nikaṭe—nearby; hari-dhvani śuni'-after hearing the chanting of the Hare Kṛṣṇa mahā-mantra; parakāśānanda—Prakāśānanda Sarasvatī; dekhite—to see; kautuke—in great eagerness; āilā—came; lañā—taking; śiṣya-vṛnda—all the disciples.
translation: When Prakāśānanda Sarasvatī, who was staying nearby, heard this tumultuous chanting of the Hare Kṛṣṇa mahā-mantra, he and his disciples immediately came to see the Lord.
